utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Two spades.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Three hearts.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: It's all yours.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: I'm forced.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: And that's five. And that's six. Not bad. On a slam contract, you normally want to play your winners early.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sorry Dad.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Nah, you're learning, you're doing fine.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Carny Gilman's a good player. And a widow.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: I should take her out because she can play bridge? You're a true romantic.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: You should ask somebody out. You think Cecile's not dating yet?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Cecile was dating before she left.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Oh shut up, Mark.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: No, I have a partner, and she's doing great.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Amy should be out having fun.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I'm having fun.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Yeah, look like you're having the time of your life.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: One, no trump.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Ooh!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I'm just a little nauseous I umm... I think I ate too much. Can we take a break?

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Of course. Excuse us?

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: What did you eat?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Nothing weird.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Have you been drinking?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No. Dad, you know I--

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Because I don't mind if you--

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Dad? Dad? Dad?! What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You're scaring me, it hurts! Let go!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What are you doing?!

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Henry! Henry! Let go of her!

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: --the occasional drink doesn't bother me but... what?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You ok?

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: What's the matter?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You had what's called an absence seizure. Anything like that happen to you before?

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: No, nothing.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: He's been really healthy. He jogs, he eats right, he--

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Well I did have a headache last Sunday, and for the past 2 years I've been getting acid reflux a lot and I thought that err... antacids were all I needed. Should I have come in sooner?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: For acid reflux and a headache?

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: You know, I hear the coffee downstairs is really good. Could you get me a cup, honey? Would you mind closing the blinds?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: His right testicle is almost twice as big as his left.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cool.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's probably testicular cancer.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. That's impossible.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The symptoms all indicate--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The shoes aren't right. Here's how testicular cancer would manifest itself. First the patient would get the exact symptoms that he's got, then Foreman would examine him, then he'd suspect testicular cancer on the count of the symptoms being so perfect, then he'd stick a needle in it, then he'd call a surgeon. And while that guy operates, the rest of us would be out bowling. And since we're not wearing bowling shoes, the disease obviously did not progress in that fashion.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: LP showed some white cells, but his MRI is clean.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sure, if you call a micro-abscess in his brain "clean".

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What you don't trust me?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Are you talking about the left temporal lobe?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Neat! You can see through my hand!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's just a shadow.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or it's an infection. When guys have brain-crotch problems, it's usually the result of using one too much and the other too little.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Blood and urine were negative for syphilis, gonorrhea and chlamydia.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So treat him for all 3. Stat.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Umm... negative means he doesn't have it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, negative means he probably doesn't have it, which means he probably has cancer.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I thought we were wearing the wrong shoes for cancer.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We're wearing the wrong shoes for testicular cancer. They're perfect for lymphoma. Except Chase's, they're just goofy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Lymphoma could cause infiltrates in his reproductive organs and his brain. If it does advance he's dead no matter what we do. So give him the STD meds, and hope the tests were wrong.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Spinook. Who's the lucky woman?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: My wife.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, I don't want to know who gets the chocolates; I want to know who you're having the affair with.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Fell on his head as a child, tragic.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Norwegian chocolate. Frankly, you buy that stuff the terrorists win.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Some people bottle up their feelings, have them come out as physical pain. Healthy human beings express feelings such as affection by giving gifts.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Gifts express guilt. The more expensive the expression, the deeper the guilt. That's a 12 dollar box so that means you haven't slept with her yet, or she wasn't that good.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's not all about sex, House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Really? When did that change?

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: I wanna get depo provera.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Actually, at your age, as long as you're careful, the risk of you getting pregnant is pretty limited.

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: Yeah but it would calm me down, right? If I get a high enough dose.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You mean calm as in... peaceful lake on a cool summer evening? Or in the lesser used meaning of nothing can ever bother you again because life has absolutely no meaning? High dose of depo provera will chemically castrate you.

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ok... I'm going to get up to leave now. I'm going to walk to that door, turn the handle, and then you're suddenly going to decide that you have to tell me the truth. I'm going to have to turn around and come all the way back. You see the thing is, my leg hurts. Can we cut the walking out of the equation?

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: I love cows.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Any particular variety? Guernseys? Holstein?

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: Which are the black and white ones?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh god.

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: I pass a farm on my way to school. And they're so beautiful. They're so majestic I dream about them. Leather shoes, hamburgers. How can anybody do that to a cow?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Make love, not belts. Beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: I haven't actually--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh relax; it's something we doctors deal with all the time. And I'm going to write you the name of a drug, you don't need a prescription and looks just like depo provera.

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: But does it do the same thing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh god no. That stuff has all sorts of nasty side effects. It's real medicine. Now this is all you need, your frat buddies will be completely fooled. You tell them how appalling the doctor was, lots of laughs.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We think you may have a sexually transmitted disease.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: No, it's not possible.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sir, maybe we should speak in private?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Have you tested him for this?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The tests were negative.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Well, then it's not that. So what else could it be?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Nothing good. If you've been having sex, you HAVE to tell me.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: I have not had sex since my divorce.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn't ask him to take the medicine; I asked you do give him the medicine.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He hasn't had sex in over a year.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's lying.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He knows what's at stake. We should start treating him for lymphoma right away. Maybe if we hit him hard and fast--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wilson! How long can you go without sex?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: How long can you go without annoying people?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No seriously, a week? A month?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm not having an affair.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn't say you were. Not in this conversation. I'm talking about a patient!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: People have impulse control, we don't NEED sex.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well not like air, but as a biological imperative, sure we do. There's two things we get stupid for - money and sex, and since money rarely enters the bloodstream. Was his daughter in the room when you asked if he had sex?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I told him we could talk privately, he didn't care if she was there.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's almost noon. The little girl would go to lunch. Soon as she's out the door, you're going to get paged. Then you page me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Lunch is early huh?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hi, I'm doctor House. I hear you'd rather die than admit you had sex.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: I'm sorry I... couldn't tell my daughter.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right, coz she's what? 22?

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: I slept with her mom.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She probably knows that's happened already. Roll over.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: My wife had an affair, I forgave her. She had another affair and I forgave her again and... Amy thinks I was an idiot.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So smart. You must be very proud. Roll over.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: I assume that you've been in love.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is that the one that makes you pants feel funny? I'm starting you on a cocktail of STD meds.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Amy is just getting over it. She barely spoke to her mom for months and if she thought that it was happening again and that's why I got sick... We... we just happened to be at the same Italian cheese-tasting thing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cheese is the devil's plaything.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: It was just the one night.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well you're obviously completely over her.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Amy thinks love leads you to make stupid choices.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're certainly setting a good example for her.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: She just doesn't get it. If you're not prepared to look stupid then nothing great is ever going to happen, right? On the other hand, I guess your testicles aren't gonna explode either.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Dad? Is everything ok?

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: I have a sexually transmitted disease.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: How's that possible?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He met a woman in church.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Does she play bridge?

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Does she...?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Crash cart!

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Is this another seizure?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: Nurses
utterance.content: Coming in!

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: Here you go

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 40 milligrams Knock him out.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: How would an STD do this?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It wouldn't.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It was flash pulmonary edema. We took a litre of fluid off but the problem wasn't with his lungs. It's his heart. There are vegetations obstructing his mitral valve.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's not an STD. Lymphoma wouldn't erupt that suddenly.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So what is it? A disease that attacks his brain, heart and testicles. I think Byron wrote about that.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Could be psittacosis.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Chlamydia cultures would have come back positive.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Strep viridans can hit the heart.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Wouldn't mess with the reproductive system. Maybe things aren't so nicely connected. He's 65. We could be looking at multiple systems just starting to break down independently.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Way to a man's heart is through his stomach.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He's had acid reflux for years. It can't be relevant.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Seems there are other ways to kill people besides having sex with them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You don't need this so much. Problem is not your lungs, it's your heart. That Italian cheese thing at the church - what sort of cheese?

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Why do you need to know?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm having a fondue party. Was it sheep cheese?

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Might have been. Why?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Was it soft?

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Taste like crap?

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Uhh... yeah. Bitter.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Taste like this?

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Yeah. But... how did you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That was regular low fat American. I added some bacteria for flavour.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You fed him bacteria?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's pretty much on everything. Especially the unpasteurised sheep cheese they make in the Alps. That stuff will give you brucellosis. Key to a long life - exotic women, and boring cheese. I'm going to start you on rifampin and doxycycline.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Doesn't make any sense. I mean nobody else at the "church" got sick.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 99.9% of "Christians" have so much acid in their stomach they become churning cauldrons of death for all those nasty brucellosis bugs. But you were taking antacids for your acid reflux, so that turns your digestive tract into a pleasant scenic river for all those bacterial tourists.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You sure you're right?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Absolutely. Your socks don't match, which means you got out dressed in the dark, which means you don't want to wake your wife which means you don't want to talk to her, which means--

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I was referring to your patient.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh that. No. Come on, I'm basing it on cheese!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: How long before you get the tests back?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We'll know before that. If I'm wrong, he'll just keep getting worse and slowly die. And if I'm right, either we caught it in time he gets better, or we didn't and he goes into cardiac arrest at any moment.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Paddles! Charging. 250. Clear! Charging, 300. Clear! Charging, 360. Clear! Epinephrine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Are you going to tell her?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That you suspect an affair? Sure. She already hates you, why not?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because you think that getting it off your chest will let you sleep better. It won't. You'll end up sleeping on my lumpy couch.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: There's nothing to tell.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why are you playing foosball here at 8 o' clock at night?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You always want to simplify everything. Boil it down to nice, easy equations, nice easy answers.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Go home and have sex with your wife.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: His heart is back and sinus rhythm. Has a lot of damage though.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It was brucellosis but we got to it too late. Vegetation broke off into his main coronary artery and caused an infarction.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: His heart muscle's half-dead. He'll be lucky to last a week.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Other than that, how's he doing? Seriously. His brain, testicle, lungs, tonsils. How's all that other stuff doing?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Uhh his brain is clear now, and so is the genital and urinary tract and his kidney function is good.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So... all he needs is a heart, and he's out of here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's a prime candidate for transplant. Doesn't smoke. Drinks moderately. His tox screen is negative for illegal drugs, and legal ones. Surveillance blood culture show absolutely no sign of any lingering brucella bacteria.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: He's 66-yrs-old.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Told me he was 65. Liar. I'm out of here.

utterance.speaker: Simpson
utterance.content: There is an inverse correlation between patient age and success rates.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's in excellent health. This was his first hospitalisation since breaking his leg at 23. Or 22, I'm not sure anymore.

utterance.speaker: Simpson
utterance.content: If this patient were to survive the operation, he'd get another what? 5, 10, maybe 20 years if he's very lucky?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So you're saying that old people aren't as worth saving as young people?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: He's saying that hearts are a scarce resource. We obviously have to choose criteria--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No I get it; women live longer so they should get preference, right? The African-Americans, they die a lot younger so to hell with them.

utterance.speaker: Simpson
utterance.content: What you think you're going to win me over by calling me a racist?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If the test is who gets to use it the longest, you can either be a racist or a hypocrite.

utterance.speaker: Simpson
utterance.content: Your patient had a life. A family. We've got 18-yr-old kids who only--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How old are you, doctor? When do we get to toss you on an ice flow?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: And thank you doctor House. Unless anybody else has any further questions, we will now go into private session.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh I'm on pins and needles. I wonder how you'll decide.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: The Mets just won their third game in a row. Beat the Lakers.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm sorry. They voted no.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: So... then... will I die?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Might have a week.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I wrote a letter to the Board of Directors appealing the Transplant Committee's decision. I'm alleging bias against you clouded their medical judgement. I need you to sign.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They made the right call.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You don't believe that. You told the committee--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was advocating for my patient.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Then why are you--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Advocating for my patient. I gotta go clinic duty. I need you to get me the files on everybody who dies here today.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You really think this thing will change their decision?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Moooo!

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: I think I broke my ankle. I was kicked by a hoof. I'm so in love. She was so beautiful.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which one?

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: One of the black and white ones, I'm not sure what type--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not which type, which one? I want a name.

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: Why would it have a name?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not "it", she. Or he. I wanna know her dreams, her hopes.

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: It's a cow.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, I'm not the one who said he was in love. People who actually have this condition rationalise it, they dismiss it, they don't elevate it to the level of poetry. Plus there's a wooden splinter in there. So either you hit yourself with a 2 by 4 or Elsie has a pick leg. I'm off duty at 6, give yourself another whack and come back and scam somebody else.

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: I'm sick. And you're a doctor, you have a duty to help me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Technically I don't have to treat anybody before running a series of painful and often humiliating tests.

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: Whatever you need.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: 90-yr-old woman died of pneumonia.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Unless she has a bionic heart. What's next?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Umm... baby, died in the ICU.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Babies are useless, they got hearts the size of ping-pong balls. Next.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Err... 40-yr-old male.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Heart attack.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you really cared about me, you'd find me a better corpse.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No other deaths. There's one woman who was in a car accident.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bad one I hope.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Don't think the procurement people have been notified.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Give me her file.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It's in the ER; they're still looking on her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Age?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Not 40.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Young, damn.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Young is good.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Smoker?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Don't know.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Find out.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: She's still alive. Even if we get on the list, we can't go near her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Overweight?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: She's on the hefty side.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Excellent. Our odds just went up.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: What odds? What is this?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 60% of potential donor hearts get tossed in the trash because there's something wrong with them. With fat people, it's closer to 80.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: But if her heart's no good then--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Big fat sloppy heart beats no heart all

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Are you Mr Neuberger?

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm Doctor House. Need to ask you a few questions about your wife.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: Is she going to be ok?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm afraid I don't know that. Could you tell me about her accident?

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: They think she fell asleep, went off the road, that's all they told me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Any problems with her health until now?

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Police say it's important.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: Erm... she had a fever today but otherwise she was--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How high?

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: 101. She hasn't missed a day of teaching in... years. And I should have made her stay home.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Any other symptoms?

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: A stomachache. Who cares? She was in a car crash!

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Mr Neuberger.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: My name's Ellen Stanmer, I'm the Organ Procurement Coordinator for Southern New Jersey. I just want to assure you that we'll treat her organs with care and dignity.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: Her organs?! Laura died?

utterance.speaker: Ellen
utterance.content: I... I'm sorry, I thought umm... she was just pronounced dead , I thought he was telling you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn't know. Shouldn't have made assumptions.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: What did you want from me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm sorry for your loss, but I need your wife's heart.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The Organ Procurement Coordinator just left the hospital.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Means we got lucky, either that or she's getting lunch. Dead woman's last name have a 'u' or a 'w'?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You're hacking into a confidential patient file?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is that a problem for you?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It's a 'u'. N - E - U.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Three minutes ago... her organs were officially declared not viable. Time to go dumpster diving.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hey, she's got Hepatitis C, her ALTs are three times normal. With Henry's immune system down, an infected heart will kill him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fortunately, she didn't have Hep C.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She tested positive.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Her history says otherwise. Her husband told me she was running a fever with stomach pains, not symptomatic of Hep C.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: Hey what are you doing? What are you doing? What are you doing?!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Again, sorry. But we need to talk.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Mr Neuberger has every right to take his wife off the ventilator.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: His wife signed an organ donor card.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Which became invalid when her organs were turned down.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I can use them! I just need some time! Committee says they won't take her heart. Another committee says a guy can't have a heart. It's a marriage made in heaven. I can find a surgical team that can do this. Classify it as experimental, it's not going to screw with any numbers. This is what she wanted; she wanted her organs to help another--

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: She never wanted to be kept alive on a ventilator.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's not, she's dead! She's not in pain, she's not suffering. It's just her... meat we're dealing with here.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: This is my wife.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not anymore.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: She deserves some respect. Some dignity.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I respect the living.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: Right, that is why you made me think that you were her doctor. Made me believe that maybe there was some hope.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I never said that I was her doctor.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: Fine you didn't lie, but you sure as hell didn't give me any respect! I'm taking her off the machines. Now!

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Nicely played.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not over.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Excuse me, are you Mr Neuberger?

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: Yeah, why?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I'm Amy Arrington. I wanted to thank you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This girl's father will die by next weekend unless he gets your wife's heart.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House, don't you think that's a little manipulative?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, it's hugely manipulative.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: You're an ass.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey listen, you take your wife off life support, and I'll have forgotten about this in two weeks. Gale here on the other hand--

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Amy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Whatever. You're mad at me, fine I get that, take it out on me, not on her.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: Fine. Your dad can err... have her heart.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fever, stomach pain, raised liver enzymes.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She's sick.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Worse than that, she's dead.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: My point is, even if it's not Hep C, it's something. They turned it down as a donor because if we put that heart into someone, they won't survive. Whatever made her sick will kill him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. So what is it? Enzymes indicate--

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You want us to do a differential diagnosis on a dead person?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We're going to cure her.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We're going to cure death?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: MWAHAHAHAHA. Doubt it. Just want to get the infection out of her heart before we get the heart out of her. The fever indicates an infection.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She probably has Hep C and a bad case of the flu.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Let's assume, just for fun, that the answer is something that might be helpful.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Fever and belly pain. Could be a gall bladder infection.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Like that. Do an MRI, stat.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You really don't need to be here.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: I assume House is a great doctor.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why would you assume that?

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: Because when you're that big a jerk, you're either great or unemployed.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No sign of gall bladder infection, but there was a cyst.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Perfectly round. Now Hep C would explain--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Question was never is it Hep C? Question was given that it's not Hep C, what is it?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Adenoma?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Not solid enough.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Cavernous hemangioma?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Not vascular enough.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What if she was sloppy about washing her hands after pooping?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Err... ameba infection?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The amebias started in her liver and spread to her blood, that would explain all her symptoms. Except for the crushed skull but I'm assuming that's from the car crash.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'll start her on paromycin and chloroquine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 10 grams each.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That's... 20 times the normal dose.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right. So we'll destroy her retinas and damage her hearing. Whoever wants those parts is having a very bad day. Couple of hours on the meds and she'll be feeling great.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Got your labs. Do you eat guinea pigs?

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How about hamsters? Or mice? Humans?

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: What are you talking about? Is something wrong with me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Absolutely nothing. Blood work is perfect. You got lots of vitamins, minerals, all kinds of proteins. Including a little something I like to call 'bovine serum albumin' which you get from eating the animals mentioned. Or cow. You don't really worship cows. So I have to wonder, what could be more humiliating than someone calling your girlfriend a cow and not being metaphorical.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nice.

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: It's my mom.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well either that's a very old photograph or it's your step mom.

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: She goes around the house in a bikini. Or less. I... I can't stop thinking about her. My dad's in Europe. I... I'll be watching TV, she'll give me a massage, I can't walk for an hour.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Still. Cows.

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: She's my mother!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Step.

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: Please? I just need the medicine for 3 months until I graduate and I move out of the house. Please.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're not going to have any fun at graduation.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Keep up the good work. Your shirt is ironed. That means you haven't told your wife anything.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Let's say you're right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're saying I'm right?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No. Let us say. Does it occur to you that maybe there's some deeper guidance than keep your mouth shut? That maybe a friend might value concern over glibness? That maybe... maybe I'm going through something that I need to have an actual conversation about?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Does it occur to you that if you need that kind of a friend, that you may have made some deeper errors.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Her heartbeat's irregular. Looks like global hypokinesis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Stop the meds.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: Are you giving up?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Either we're wrong, and our heart is unusable, or we're right, but the treatment we have to give her will make her heart unusable. I'm sorry. You can pull the plug now. Find me another body. That fat guy on the other end of the service didn't look so hot.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: No! She's not ready.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You were ready this morning.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: She's not done. She's gotta save that guy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Alternate theories?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Amebiasis was our best hope. The fact that her heart rate went back to normal when we stopped the meds pretty much--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What's our second best hope?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: House, we're down to one, there's no obstruction.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Maybe we should just biopsy it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's a fridge with the power out. We start poking around inside, the vegetable goes bad. No offence.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I don't see that we have a lot of choice. The only way we're going to find that infection--

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: What if it's not an infection? Toxins can cause similar symptoms, especially if whatever it is did liver damage.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: Her err... toxin screen was clean.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Those things never cover for any of the really cool toxins. Run the screen again for... whatever you can think of. You keep the other patient alive, you check out her school, and I seem to need to hire another doctor to go search her home. Come on.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: If she was taking any medications, I'd know about it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Does your wife dye her hair?

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: No. Her mom never went grey, she didn't either.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Guess this must be yours then. Can you think of anything else she might have lied to you about? Any drugs she "gave up" when she married you?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How are you feeling sir? Mr Arrington? Mr Arrington?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: His heart's not pumping enough blood to his brain, we're going to have to give him some help. Get the balloon ready.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do you use this drawer?

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: No, that's for her vitamins.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And sleeping pills.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: She never took sleeping pills.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ok. You on a diet?

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: No. I guess you never really know someone do you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Quite the insight. She lied to you about her hair colour, and didn't want you to know she thought she was fat. Unless you never lied to her about anything that huge, I think you can probably let those slide.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Diet pills could have messed her up. Raised her liver enzymes and caused the belly ache.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But not the fever.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Maybe something else set off the fever.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Before I show you these, they were in a locked drawer in her desk, the vice principal said that Laura must have confiscated them, they've had some problems--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Neither interesting nor helpful. This at least is interesting.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No it's not.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sex with teenagers isn't interesting? Where did you grow up?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It isn't helpful. Teenage boys aren't toxins.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What if the cyst isn't a cyst?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Then we have nothing to go on.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I said it's not a cyst, I didn't say it was nothing. What if it's a scar?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Fitzhugh-Curtis syndrome? Pushing gonorrhea again?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You have anything better? Test her. Then start her on ceftriaxone.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: What are you testing for now?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Just some more infections.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: She's positive for gonorrhea!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I think that's the first time those words have been uttered in joy.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Meds are started. Her heart should be clear enough to use in about 4 or 5 hours. I'll go tell the families.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He's in a coma.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Start him on dobutamine.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Already did. We either do the surgery now or we find him a new brain too.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: House, she's still got a significant amount of gonorrhea in her system.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hopefully tomorrow, it'll be in his system. I need two ORs and the transplant team.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: I assume this means that you found out what was wrong with Laura?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She... had amebiasis. We just found a different way to get rid of it.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: That was kind of you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn't want him going postal on us. Soon as his wife's heart's in our hands, you can tell him about the gonorrhea. He's gotta be tested. Preferably before he gets any sympathy sex.

utterance.speaker: Doctor
utterance.content: Paddles. 50 joules. Charging. Charging. Let's take him off bypass.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Mr Neuberger, there's something I need to tell you.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: For the last err... year, or so... Laura was kind of distant with me. I don't know why. I thought... maybe she was having an affair, but not Laura. And I'm not excusing myself, but I was travelling during Christmas, I had a... I had a one-night-stand. I got gonorrhea.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: Yup. I should have said something to you. But I didn't want to believe that I gave it to her. That's what made her sick and... that... was why she got into the accident.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Cecile? Am I dead?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hopefully not for a long time.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Why are you here?

utterance.speaker: Cecile
utterance.content: Amy called me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: If you do mom again, you gotta wear a condom.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're going to have gonorrhea in your system for a while.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Could I stay with you for a few days?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You idiot. You told her.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She told me. Things have been crappy at home lately, I figured I wasn't spending enough time with her. I figured... Turns out you're right, it's always about sex. She's been having an affair.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Want a beer?
